contenido:
To protect pets from theft, the Animal Cruelty Taskforce of Southern Arizona suggests owners:

• Keep pets in the house or yard.

• Provide identification tags for dogs and cats and county licenses for dogs.

• Microchip pets and keep information updated.

• Keep current photos of a pet's face and body.

• Have current vet records for identification.

• Call 911 to report suspicious activities or animal injuries, deaths or theft.

• File a lost report with the Humane Society: 327-6088.

• For nonemergency reports, call Pima County Sheriff's Department: 741-4900, and Tucson Police Department: 791-4444.

• Contact neighbors, neighborhood associations and neighborhood watch organizations.
